meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Tom is known as a bludger because he never helps with chores.
meanings.sent2: The bludger always finds excuses to skip work.
meanings.sent3: The bludger tried to convince others to do his job for him.
meanings.sent4: Being a bludger is like carrying an invisible weight of laziness.
meanings.sent5: The image of a bludger lounging on the couch is hard to forget.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a bludger and start helping out around the house.
meanings.sent2: The bludger spent the whole day napping instead of working.
meanings.sent3: The bludger's idea of exercise is lifting the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: His laziness turned him into a professional bludger.
meanings.sent5: The bludger's lack of motivation was evident to everyone around him.

meanings.definition: A tool used for hitting or striking.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a bludger to hammer the nails into place.
meanings.sent2: The bludger made a loud sound as it struck the metal.
meanings.sent3: The bludger accidentally hit his thumb instead of the nail.
meanings.sent4: The bludger's handle was worn from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The bludger's impact echoed through the workshop.
